title: Michigan Firm Recalls Pigs in the Blanket Products Due To Misbranding and Undeclared Allergen
summary: WASHINGTON, Dec. 21, 2012 -Stehouwer's Frozen Foods, a Grand Rapids, Mich. establishment, is recalling approximately 6,039 pounds of Pigs in the Blanket products because of misbranding and an undeclared allergen, milk, which is not declared on the label, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety...

establishment.name: Stehouwer's Frozen Foods, Inc.
establishment.address:
2055 Bristol Avenue NW 
  Grand Rapids, MI 49504

impacted_products: 13.5-lb. cases of "Stehouwer's Pigs in the Blanket." Each case contains 12 individual 18-oz. packages of "Stehouwer's Pigs in the Blanket." The products were produced on Sept. 27, 2012, Oct. 25, 2012, and Dec. 13, 2012, and they have use by dates of Sept.
5-lb. bulk packages of "Stehouwer's Pigs in the Blanket." These packages are labeled "FOR INSTITUTIONAL USE ONLY." They were produced on Oct. 25, 2012, and have the use by date of 102513.
